text: scored his Excellency
the assembly will hear an address by his
Excellency naive Armando bouquet
president of the Republic of El Salvador
I request protocol to escort his
Excellency
on behalf of the general assembly
I have the honor to welcome his
Excellency type Armando bouquet
president of the Republic of El Salvador
and to invite him to address the
assembly
[Applause]
president
Excellency president of the general
assembly
heads of state and government
my wife
Gabriella my daughter Lila
distinguished members of the different
delegations here with us today
friends watching us on the different
platforms
ladies and gentlemen
since the first time I came to this
assembly I've reminded you of the needs
to renew and to reinvent ourselves
and I'm not only referring to this
organization or to this General Assembly
but rather to all countries especially
those that have similar circumstances to
ours
nor did I say this just because but
rather because I believe it and because
in my country in El Salvador this is
what we're doing
El Salvador like other developing
countries has always dreamed of being
great
for some countries this dream
at some point became possible however
for others like our country this was
always something unthinkable
we didn't believe it was possible
or even that we'd get close
in fact I think that nobody listened to
this speech would have thought that
they'd say the name El Salvador hear it
and think of a global Benchmark or a
positive example however despite all of
the stumbling blocks we signed it
decided to take the risk we didn't
accept the Fate that others had decided
for us
now today four years since my government
took office nobody
would even dare to deny that for the
first time in its 202 years of History
the smallest country on our continent
would have made such great strides
forwards to achieve this dream of
greatness in such a short amount of time
El Salvador went from being the world
Capital the world's murder capital
from being the most dangerous country in
the world to becoming the safest country
in Latin America
this isn't a promise anymore it's the
reality that the El Salvadorian people
are living through and anyone from
abroad is welcome to go and see it for
themselves
thus many people in the world are
following what's happening in our
country especially in Latin America
however also in the United States and
elsewhere they're seeing what's
happening in El Salvador and wondering
why they can't do the same in their
country
the answer is a claim and simple they
must make their own decisions
they must reaffirm their rights to use
common sense to try their own methods
and to implement their own plans and to
design their own systems
no country has the right to impose its
ideas to impose their way of doing
things even less when these things don't
even work in our countries
in every single one of the decisions
that we've made we have reaffirmed our
legitimate rights to govern ourselves
even if this could have meant making a
mistake
however we didn't make a mistake we were
successful in fact we had a resounding
success
and so we didn't only reaffirm our right
to make our own decisions but also our
right to be right
there's not one single recipe or single
formula that works at the same for
everyone however I do believe that there
is one ingredient that all recipes
should include or should at least have
the rights to include and this
ingredient is courage
it's necessary to have the right
attitude the guts the determination to
do what needs to be done even when other
people are questioning you or
criticizing you
for decades
we tried everything that we were told
was the right thing for us
and it got us fighting a civil war for
things that were far removed from us
because the conflict between the west
and the Soviet Union was being waged in
our country more than 85
000 people dead and one destroyed
country later they told us that actually
that wasn't the right recipe but that
now there was a new recipe available and
so they made us sign up to some fake
peace agreements there was no peace in
them and the only thing that they did
was enable two different gangs to
plunder the loot they tried each
different formula and nothing worked and
then being under foreign powers the
country went to the right and then later
also under uh foreign actors the country
went to the left and that was the
situation during the 30-year post-war
period where there were more deaths than
during the Civil War more poverty and
more violence
nobody did anything to change the root
causes of the system nor the
institutions and certainly not the laws
either everything that happened over
those years was done with the support of
the consent and
the imposition of those who proclaimed
themselves to be the great Defenders of
Human Rights and Democratic
institutionality
rather than giving us medicine to make
us better in fact what they were giving
us was poison they claimed that we
should continue to do the same as what
had been done in the past
they claimed that the same people that
had looted our country and killed us
should continue to govern or at least
share power however this time we told
them no we turned down their poison and
for the first time we tried our own
remedy
thank god it worked the first thing that
we did was to ensure that we had God and
the people on board because no
transformation that's worth its while
can be done obeying
um external powers
and secondly we created our own methods
a method that was designed for our own
reality created by those who experienced
this reality in our own flesh and blood
then uh the El Salvadorian people gave
us uh vested their trust in us twice
through vote some several times but
perhaps these two votes were the most
important and that first the first of
the two votes was when they elected me
as their president the second was when
they decided to give us governability
then we knew that we had an obligation
to our people
an obligation to make the decisions
required in order to address our most
pressing problem in security we needed
to make those decisions
the efforts that were being made to uh
improve health or the economy were
pointless if our people continued to be
killed and there was no point in
transforming education if the
gangs were giving orders in our prisons
to cow murder our children cowardly and
forcefully recruit our youth
we couldn't decide to invest millions of
dollars in building and improving our
road infrastructure if the El
Salvadorian people couldn't even walk
around the streets and so we made the
decision to purge the
Judiciary and the prison system and then
we changed laws to ensure that
terrorists wouldn't Escape out of prison
anymore
and it was uh at that time that
International condemnation started some
countries some meter outlets and some
so-called experts
started systematic attacks against us
for all of the decisions we were making
people who never used their power or
influence to call for security for our
people who are being murdered suddenly
started to speak against the decisions
we were making to stop this massacre
countries that never condemned the
murder of between 30 40 or even 50 El
Salvadorian people per day suddenly
started calling for explanations on why
we changed the public prosecutor's
office why we changed magistrates or
judges don't you think that's absurd to
question us for that who is responsible
for the policy for domestic Security in
any country in the world well the answer
is it's the responsibility of the
government the executive through the
State security forces through the
penitentiary for the penitentiary system
in cooperation with the public
prosecutor's office and with the
Judiciary this was an indispensable
condition for everyone to work together
in the same direction for the plan to
work
if we had left the same public
prosecutor in office if we had left the
same judges in place
as before that were being protected by a
lot of people and
um
well then we would still be the world's
murder capital if we had listened if we
had
we would have continued to lose
thousands and thousands of El
Salvadorian people to terrorists thank
God we didn't pay any attention to them
every single one of the decisions that
we have made have led us to this point
today El Salvador competes with Canada
for being the safest country on the
continent we're not only the country in
Latin America with the least homicides
per capita by a long way but we have
also reduced uh all crime to a minimum
level people can now walk around the
streets that for a long time they
weren't able to walk around due to the
guns businesses are no longer paying its
Dawson money children are now able to go
and play in the park without being
scared of being recruited or murdered
these are things that a lot of you might
take for granted think of basic to walk
around your streets but in uh our
country they didn't exist we have been
criticized and condemned for all of the
decisions we've made at all times
intellectuals journalists politicians
and organizations from across the board
have been focused on a debate over what
we're doing and I've come here to tell
you that
there's no time for this debate anymore
because the decisions that we took were
the right ones we are no longer the
world murder capital and we managed to
achieve this in record time today we are
a benchmark of security and nobody can
cast out on that the results are there
they are irrefutable
and El Salvador we did the right thing
for El Salvador
and now we benefit from this level of
security we've been able to open up our
countries for the entire world and this
year alone we received thousands of
athletes at the Central American and
Caribbean Games We Are the World
epicenter of surf and we have just
signed up to an agreement with Google to
digitalize the states and services like
education and health
we are receiving more and more tourism
both domestic and uh from overseas more
and more people are coming to see what
we're doing and investing in El Salvador
many of el salvadorians abroad that
spent years without returning home are
now investing in the country and have
plans to come home
according to a study carried out last
year in 2022 by the International
Organization for migration uh United
Nations agency more than 60 percent
60 of the El Salvadorian people who live
in the United States there are lots of
us have ignorance in the United States
plan to return to El Salvador
we know that we still have a lot to do
however we are on track to achieving our
goal of reversing the mass Exodus of El
Salvadorian people as a result of all of
the wrong decisions made in the past and
the Civil War and to achieve our dream
of having reverse migration for more El
Salvadorian people to return than leave
the country and the studies of the very
United Nations are already showing this
within a few months we will also be
hosting Miss Universe
and that is another event that will put
us in the eyes of the world and will
bring even more tourism and even more
investment in addition to all of this we
are establishing more and better
relationships with our allies who want
to support us to build our country to
build our dream
and I'm not just saying all of this to
boast although I am very proud of
everything that we have achieved I'm
saying this because this is an example
of what all countries can achieve when
they start to claim their sovereignty
look at us
we were recognized for violence and now
we're recognized for our Landscapes our
waves and above all for our courage
now the world can see our full potential
we have a country full of marvelous
things to offer people who visit us can
have can eat on the beach can
set stuff world-class waves at the
perfect temperature all year they can
have lunch in the mountains and taste
the best coffee in the world with
volcanoes and beautiful lakes
as a backdrop and they can then have
dinner in the capital
with all of its modernity Commodities
and with the security that many cities
in the first world would like to have
and they can do all of this in just one
single day but the best thing is that
they will find in our people a friendly
hard-working people that is always
looking to do something new
when they come to our country they will
realize that the El Salvadorian people
are proud of being El Salvadorian
something that just a few years ago
wasn't the case El Salvador is being
reborn because we are dared to challenge
ourselves and we decided that nothing
nor anyone
should tell us what to do we are still
very far from where we want to arrive
however we will continue to work hard
and make our own decisions so that we
can achieve this greatness that we
aspire to
we believe that the world also needs to
be reborn but this is the decision of
each different people we in El Salvador
are leading by example
uh
laying a path that anyone can take thank
you very much and may God bless all of
the nations of the world
[Applause]
on behalf of the assembly
I wish to thank the president of the
Republic of El Salvador for the
statement just made
and I request protocol to escort his
Excellency
